      ControllerProperties ControllerProperties.register(ControllerInterface<?> theController, String theProperty)
      registering a property with only one parameter assumes that there is a setter and getter function present for the Controller. register("value") for example would create a property reference to setValue and getValue.

      Classes in tech.lity.rea.skatolo.gui that implement ControllerInterface 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Controller<T>
      Controller is an abstract class that is extended by any available controller within skatolo. this is the full documentation list for all methods available for a controller.

    • Uses of ControllerInterface in tech.lity.rea.skatolo.gui.controllers

      Classes in tech.lity.rea.skatolo.gui.controllers that implement ControllerInterface 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Bang
      The Bang controller triggers an event when pressed.
      class  Button
      A button triggers an event after it has been release.
      class  Chart
      Use charts to display float array data as line chart, yet experimental, but see the skatolochart example for more details.
      class  FrameRate 
      class  HoverButton
      A button triggers an event after it has been release.
      class  HoverToggle
      a toggle can have two states, true and false, where true has the value 1 and false is 0.
      class  Knob
      A knob is a circular slider which can be used with a limited and unlimited range.
      class  Matrix
      A matrix is a 2d array with a pointer that traverses through the matrix in a timed interval. if an item of a matrix-column is active, the x and y position of the corresponding cell will trigger an event and notify the program. see the skatolomatrix example for more information.
      class  MultiList
      A Multilist is a multi-menu-tree controller. see the example for more information and how to use.
      class  MultiListButton
      Used by MultiList.
      class  Numberbox
      Click and drag the mouse inside a numberbox and move up and down to change the value of a numberbox.
      class  Range
      A range slider works just like a slider but can be adjusted on both ends.
      class  Slider
      A slider is either used horizontally or vertically. when adding a slider to skatolo, the width is compared against the height. if the width is bigger, you get a horizontal slider, is the height bigger, you get a vertical slider. a slider can have a fixed slider handle (one end of the slider is fixed to the left or bottom side of the controller), or a flexible slider handle (a handle you can drag).
      class  Slider2D
      The Slider2D allows to control a handle within a 2D area.
      class  Textfield
      A singleline input textfield, use arrow keys to go back and forth, use backspace to delete characters.
      class  Textlabel 
      class  Toggle
      a toggle can have two states, true and false, where true has the value 1 and false is 0.

    • Uses of ControllerInterface in tech.lity.rea.skatolo.gui.group

      Classes in tech.lity.rea.skatolo.gui.group that implement ControllerInterface 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Accordion
      The Accordion is a list of ControlGroups which can be expanded and collapsed.
      class  CheckBox
      A multiple-choice radioButton. items are added to a checkBox and can be organized in rows and columns. items of a checkBox are of type Toggle.
      class  ColorPicker
      A simple color picker using sliders to adjust RGBA values.
      class  ControlGroup<T>
      In previous versions you would use the ControlGroup class to bundle controllers in a group.
      class  ControllerGroup<T>
      ControllerGroup is an abstract class and is extended by class ControlGroup, Tab, or the ListBox.
      class  DropdownList 
      class  Group 
      class  ListBox
      A ListBox is a list of vertically aligned items which can be scrolled if required.
      class  Radio 
      class  RadioButton
      A radioButton is a list of toggles that can be turned on or off. radioButton is of type ControllerGroup, therefore a controllerPlug can't be set. this means that an event from a radioButton can't be forwarded to a method other than controlEvent in a sketch.
      class  Tab
      Tabs are used to organize controllers.
      class  Textarea
      a textarea can be used to leave notes, it uses the skatolo BitFont to render text.
      Methods in tech.lity.rea.skatolo.gui.group that return ControllerInterface 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ControllerInterface<?> ControllerGroup.getParent() 
      ControllerInterface<?> ControllerGroup.parent()
      Deprecated. 
      Methods in tech.lity.rea.skatolo.gui.group with parameters of type ControllerInterface 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T ControllerGroup.add(ControllerInterface<?> theElement)
      Adds a controller to the group, but use Controller.setGroup() instead.
      T ControllerGroup.bringToFront(ControllerInterface<?> theController) 
      Accordion Accordion.remove(ControllerInterface<?> theGroup)
      Removes a ControlGroup from the accordion AND from skatolo remove(ControllerInterface theGroup) overwrites it's super method. if you want to remove a ControlGroup only from the accordion, use removeItem(ControlGroup).
      T ControllerGroup.remove(ControllerInterface<?> theElement)
      Removes a controller from the group, but use Controller.setGroup() instead.

    • Uses of ControllerInterface in tech.lity.rea.skatolo.gui.widgets

      Classes in tech.lity.rea.skatolo.gui.widgets that implement ControllerInterface 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  PixelSelect
      The PixelSelect controller can be dragged to select a location.
